CODIF_DATA.AA_AUTHORITY_TYPE: Ministry or any other national or federal authority
CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01C03

TI_TEXT.P: Услуги в областта на връзките с обществеността
Usluge na području odnosa s javnošću
Storitve na področju odnosov z javnostmi

TITLE.P: Multi Supplier Framework Agreements (2 Lots) for the Provision of Public Relations/Communications (“PR”) for all Public Sector Bodies

SHORT_DESCR.P: The OGP is seeking to establish a framework/frameworks (2 x Lots above and below 25 000,00 EUR ex-vat) of Public Relations Specialists to provide public relations services either as a sole service element or bringing together different elements into one sustained campaigning approach. These services may be required on a national, local, regional or specialist basis.

TITLE.P: Lot 1

SHORT_DESCR.P: Lot 1 – It will be a matter for a Client and/or the Contracting Authority to decide how many Suppliers should be requested (minimum of 3) to submit a quotation (“Quotation”) for individual competitions under this Lot 1. The number should be proportional to the size and particular characteristics of the project concerned and should always be sufficient to ensure adequate competition.

Once a number is decided the Suppliers to be invited must be then selected by the Client and/or the Contracting Authority by way of an objective, fair, non-discriminatory, transparent and recorded/documented random selection process (“Random Selection”).

The Client and/or the Contracting Authority will issue tender documentation (a “Request for Quotation”, also referred to as an “RFQ”) to the selected Suppliers requesting a Quotation for the provision of the Services. This procedure is further defined in Clause 5 of the Framework Agreement (Appendix 6).

AC_QUALITY.AC_CRITERION: Quality1 and Quantity of key individuals

INFO_ADD.P: RFT# 116654 - MMP044F - Multi-Supplier Framework Agreements (2 Lots) for the Provision of Public Relations/Communications (“PR”) for all Public Sector Bodies.

TITLE.P: Lot 2

SHORT_DESCR.P: On each occasion that a Framework Client proposes to award a Contract under this Framework Agreement, the Contracting Authority or Client shall issue (by electronic means) a Supplementary Request for Tenders (“SRFT”) to all Framework Members in accordance with the procedure (“Mini-Competition”) as detailed at Clause 5 of the Framework Agreement (Appendix 6).

AC_QUALITY.AC_CRITERION: Quality and Quantity of key individuals
